intro: Ceratostema campii, commonly known as the campi bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Ceratostema campii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and drought tolerance.
